page.title: 05EDUCATION IN CLAYBROOKE 2
page.content: Claybrooke School Swimming Pool Claybrooke Primary School is the only school in the area which has its own swimming pool which was built in 1961 by parents contributions, and maintained by money raised by the Parent Fund Raising Committee of the school.The pool is covered by a large plastic airdome which enables it to be used from May to October. The children have a lesson every day during term time and are able to use the pool every afternoon during the summer holidays. A Parents/Begginers Club is run every Mondays and Wednesdays from 3.30-5.00p.m. A Play Group is held in Claybrooke Magna Village Hall on two mornings every week during term time.
